meaningMnemonic:
A <kanji>nothing</kanji> <kanji>occurrence</kanji> is an occurrence where nothing happens to you, or at least nothing too bad — that means you're <vocabulary>safe and sound</vocabulary>. Phew! 

In addition to meaning <vocabulary>safe</vocabulary>, 無事 can also describe a situation where everything goes off <vocabulary>without a hitch</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: One thing that's not safe and sound is the reading of the 無 in this word. Instead of む it's ぶ. Why? Because you thought it was safe and sound, but you were fooled. There are ghosts everywhere, all jumping out and screaming <reading>Boo!</reading> (ぶ) at you. Feel the surprise. You thought it was safe and sound!
